SEARCH
Package util

Class IdGenerator

java.lang.Object
util.IdGenerator
public class IdGenerator extends Object
Utility class for generating unique identifiers for various entities. Provides consistent ID generation strategies across the application.

This class generates unique IDs for:

  • Applications - Format: APP-{timestamp}-{UUID}
  • Internship Opportunities - Format: INT-{timestamp}-{UUID}
  • Withdrawal Requests - Format: WDR-{timestamp}-{UUID}
  • Sessions - Format: SES-{UUID}
  • Generic IDs - Format: {prefix}-{UUID}

All generated IDs are guaranteed to be unique and thread-safe.

Usage Example:


 String applicationId = IdGenerator.generateApplicationId();
 // Returns: APP-20250115-123456-a1b2c3d4
 
 String internshipId = IdGenerator.generateInternshipId();
 // Returns: INT-20250115-123456-e5f6g7h8
Since:
2025-01-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
SC2002 Group 6 - Member 2

      Returns:
      unique application ID

      Returns:

    • generateTimestampedId

      private static String generateTimestampedId(String prefix)
      Generates a timestamped unique ID with specified prefix. Format: {prefix}-{timestamp}-{short-uuid}
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix for the ID
      Returns:
      unique timestamped ID

    • getShortUuid

      private static String getShortUuid()
      Generates a short UUID (first 8 characters of standard UUID). Provides reasonable uniqueness while keeping IDs manageable.
      Returns:
      8-character UUID segment

    • generateSequentialId

      public static String generateSequentialId(String prefix)
      Generates a sequential numeric ID with prefix. Format: {prefix}-{6-digit-number} Thread-safe using AtomicLong.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix for the ID
      Returns:
      unique sequential ID

    • generateUuid

      public static String generateUuid()
      Generates a UUID-based unique identifier without any prefix. Standard UUID format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
      Returns:
      standard UUID string

    • generateCompactUuid

      public static String generateCompactUuid()
      Generates a compact UUID (removes dashes). Format: 32 hexadecimal characters without separators
      Returns:
      compact UUID string

    • isValidIdFormat

      public static boolean isValidIdFormat(String id, String expectedPrefix)
      Validates if a string follows the expected ID format for a given prefix.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID to validate
      expectedPrefix - the expected prefix
      Returns:
      true if ID matches the format, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      id - the ID to extract timestamp from
      Returns:
      the timestamp string, or null if format is invalid

      Returns:
      the prefix, or null if format is invalid

    • resetSequenceCounter

      public static void resetSequenceCounter()
      Resets the sequence counter (useful for testing). Warning: Should not be used in production code.
